text:
Pt admitted to [**Hospital 1294**] Hospital after being found down by husband.
   [**Name (NI) 186**] is mentally challenged and did not call ems right away so it is
   reported that pt may have been down for a couple of hours.  Upon
   arrival to ED in [**Hospital1 1294**] blood sugar was 1400's.  RIJ TL placed and
   complicated by pneumothorax.  Right chest tube placed.  Placed on
   insulin gtt and admitted to ICU.  Found to have increased liver
   enzymes, ARF and was placed on dialysis.  Pt has Quinton cath in right
   SC.  On [**7-17**] pt was extubated for four hours and then had to be
   reintubated.  U/A found to have [**Female First Name (un) **], blood cx's negative from OSH,
   cath tip from original fem line shown to have beta strep B from OSH.
   Head CT's negative x 2 and abd CT shows small bowel thickened and
   ascites at OSH.  Ultrasound today shows distended gallbladder.  Pt
   transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for ? ERCP. Tbili flat, no indication for ERCP at
   this time.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Continues to be intubated on a/c see flowsheet for most up to date
   settings
   Action:
   Tried cpap yesterday
   Response:
   Unable to tolerate cpap, fio2 was increased to 50%
   Plan
   \
   Continue to monitor , pt. has been intubated x2 weeks including osh ?
   trach soon if unable to wean
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt. is very restless, thrashing in bed, hr rises to 120
s-140
s when
   she is agitated
   Action:
   Midaz. Gtt is now at 3.5mg.hr and fent is at 250mcg/hr with some
   boluses, when she is very restless
   Response:
   Less agitated but still restless, throws legs over siderails
   Plan:
   [**Name (NI) 1409**] pt. safe. Wrists are restrained
